document_data.name: ''Messenger of Sseth''
document_data.creator: [[Apali]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Messenger of Sseth''''' was a powerful [[enchanted]] [[Ssethssar]] [[longbow]].
document_data.Description: The ''Messenger of Sseth'' was visually distinct. The [[bow]]'s grip was banded with red and black â€“ colors of the [[yuan-ti]] archer [[Apali]]'s pious [[priest]] family. The bow's ends were carved to depict [[snake]] heads, symbolizing the yuan-ti deity [[Sseth]].
document_data.Powers: The longbow was a powerful ''+2'' enchanted weapon that allowed the wielder to launch three [[arrow]]s per six seconds.
document_data.History:
This bow was crafted thousands of years before the {{YearlinkName|1281}}, by a warm-blood hater named Apali. The yuan-ti was a powerful and long-living archer who slew countless men, women, and children with the ''Messenger of Sseth'' over the course of several centuries he lived through. Apali was killed in [[Chessenta]] by a cleric of [[Assuran]] in revenge for the murder of the cleric's great-grandparent in [[Chult]] a century earlier.

The bow changed hands until it reached the [[Dragon's Eye]] on the [[Spine of the World]]. In 1281 DR, the ''Messenger of Sseth'' was wielded by a yuan-ti High Archer in service of a [[marilith]] [[Yxunomei]].
